definition: to make a detour/to take the long route
to wind/to coil (thread)/to rotate around/to spiral/to move around/to go round (an obstacle)/to by-pass/to make a detour/to confuse/to perplex
road/CL:條|条[tiao2]/journey/route/line (bus etc)/sort/kind
surname Lu

sentences.english: We have to shunpike there's a tailback in the city.
sentences.chinese: 現在城裏正在塞車排長隊，我們得繞路而行了。

sentences.english: I always detour the way to my home because I want to meet you.
sentences.chinese: 我常常繞路回家只是爲了遇見你。

sentences.english: Master you took the wrong way, please don't detour, thank you.
sentences.chinese: 師傅你走錯了，請別繞路，謝謝。

definition: lit. flower viewing from horseback (idiom); fig. superficial understanding from cursory observation/to make a quick judgment based on inadequate information
to thumb a lift/to hitchhike
long-distance coach
careless/casual/vague/not so bad/so-so/tolerable/fair
to bargain/to cut or beat down a price
domestic flight/internal line (air, train, ferry etc)
to go round a curve/to turn a corner/fig. a new direction
to try one's luck/to leave sth to chance
shuttle bus (or train)/train or bus traveling only part of its normal route
the road one must follow or take/the only way/same as 必由之路[bi4 you2 zhi1 lu4]
to fish in troubled water (idiom); to take advantage of a crisis for personal gain
street racing (motorbikes or cars)
road sign
to eat one's fill/to be full
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
(slang) rich, good-looking guy
